fields.shortIntroText_id: Mengamati proses pembentukan kelompok etnis atau asimilasi orang-orang maritim dengan kelompok imigran merupakan catatan penting untuk mengembangkan pemahaman seputar keberagaman dan persatuan penduduk Nusantara yang penuh dengan paradoks. Di samping itu, organisasi sosial penduduk pedesaan yang bersifat statis dan sudah berlangsung lama, seperti masyarakat Sunda, juga mencuatkan pertanyaan tentang identitas Nusantara. Pembentukan kelompok etnis dan identitas kelompok berlangsung dalam konteks interaksi dengan berbagai kelompok lain dan oleh sebab itu, perdagangan serta pembentukan etnis saling kait mengait secara erat.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The ethnic formation or assimilation of maritime people and immigrant groups is an important way to develop an understanding of the paradoxical diversity and unity of the people of Nusantara. The social organization of long-existing, more static rural people such as the Sundanese also raises questions about the identity of Nusantara. Ethnic formation and group identity occurred in the context of interaction with others and therefore trade and ethnic formation are closely interlinked.
fields.shortIntroText: The ethnic formation or assimilation of maritime people and immigrant groups is an important way to develop an understanding of the paradoxical diversity and unity of the people of Nusantara. The social organization of long-existing, more static rural people such as the Sundanese also raises questions about the identity of Nusantara. Ethnic formation and group identity occurred in the context of interaction with others and therefore trade and ethnic formation are closely interlinked.
fields.name_id: I.3 Rakyat, Kelompok, Etnisitas dan Organisasi Sosial
fields.name_en: I.3 Peoples, Groups, Ethnicities and Social Organization
fields.longIntroText_id:
Interaksi tersebut marak berkembang selama ‘Era Perdagangan’ dan kemudian sangat melambat selama era imperialisme di abad-abad delapan belas dan sembilan belas dan semakin ketatnya pengawasan yang dilakukan pihak penjajah. Kekuatan penjajah memang berkepentingan untuk menghambat pergerakan serta interaksi masyarakat setempat demi dapat mengendalikan mereka dengan lebih baik.

Arsip VOC merupakan sumber kaya terkait kegiatan perdagangan antar kelompok etnis. Dalam sumber-sumber itu dapat digali jejak-jejak identitas etnis dan organisasi sosial. Salah sebuah contoh adalah cacah soma atau daftar keluarga di kawasan Priangan di Jawa Barat yang berasal dari 1686 dan merupakan cacah jiwa tertua yang kami ketahui. Catatan Harian di Kastel Batavia seringkali memberikan daftar nama kepala desa di Priangan yang dapat membantu kita mereka-ulang identitas orang Sunda. Kelompok etnis lain seperti orang Jawa, Madura, Bali dan Bugis dapat mudah ditelusur dalam arsip kota Batavia. Para imigran seperti orang-orang India beragama Hindu (‘gentiven’) atau orang-orang India Muslim (‘moor’) dan orang Cina juga meninggalkan ribuan jejak mereka, misalnya, dalam surat-surat permohonan mereka dan kontrak-kontrak dagang berskala kecil. Semua pecahan informasi itu kiranya dapat membantu kami membuat analisis untuk mencapai pemahaman sejarah yang lebih baik tentang kelompok multi-etnis serta bagaimana mereka dahulu berfungsi.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Despite the fact that the Dutch presence was very limited in most Indonesian regions (what difference could a few hundred Europeans in a large island like Sumatra make?), they had a strategic interest in maintaining relations with a host of rulers and kings, often via middlemen.
As a trading company, the VOC maintained diplomatic ties with a number of ruling dynasties. The Daily Journals of Batavia Castle contain an estimated couple of thousand diplomatic letters from regional rulers and sultans. What do these letters tell us about the processes of early state- formation, power and politics? Several interesting samples from the Daily Journals are presented here.
fields.name: I.4 States, Territories, Rulers and Middlemen
fields.longIntroText:

fields.shortIntroText_id: Selama abad ke 17 dan 18, banyak negara serta Kawasan Melayu-Indonesia merupakan daerah yang diperintah secara mandiri. Banyaknya dinamika internal dan perseteruan antar Negara seperti perpecahan di dalam Negara Gelgel di Bali, Mataram di Jawa Tengah, Aceh atau kerajaan kecil Gorontalo di Sulawesi; semuanya itu terjadi tanpa campur tangan dari luar.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Many of the states and territories of the Malay-Indonesian World were ruled independently during the 17th and 18th century. Whether it be the fragmentation of the Balinese state of Gelgel, Central Javanese Mataram, Aceh or the small kingdom of Gorontalo in North Sulawesi, many of the internal dynamics and disputes over territories and borders took place independently of outside interference.
fields.shortIntroText: Many of the states and territories of the Malay-Indonesian World were ruled independently during the 17th and 18th century. Whether it be the fragmentation of the Balinese state of Gelgel, Central Javanese Mataram, Aceh or the small kingdom of Gorontalo in North Sulawesi, many of the internal dynamics and disputes over territories and borders took place independently of outside interference.
fields.name_id: I.4 Negara, Kawasan, Penguasa dan Perantara
fields.name_en: I.4 States, Territories, Rulers and Middlemen
fields.longIntroText_id:
Kendati kehadiran Belanda di sebagian besar daerah Indonesia ketika itu sangat terbatas (apakah yang dapat dilakukan beberapa ratus orang Eropa di pulau seluas Sumatra?), mereka berkepentingan untuk menjaga hubungan baik dengan para penguasa dan raja setempat yang seringkali dilakukan dengan bantuan pihak-pihak pengantara.
Sebagai sebuah perusahaan dagang, VOC menjalin hubungan diplomatik dengan sejumlah dinasti penguasa. Dalam Catatan Harian Kastil Batavia terdapat ribuan surat diplomatik dari penguasa dan sultan di kawasan tersebut. Apa yang dapat diungkapkan surat-surat itu kepada kita tentang proses awal pembentukan negara, kekuasaan serta politik? Sejumlah contoh menarik yang diambil dari Catatan Harian tersebut disampaikan berikut ini.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Priangan in the 18th century was at the centre of the world’s first coffee boom. Now it is virtually devoid of coffee shrubs and the eighteenth-century economic boom has vanished from collective memory. The Batak in North Sumatra do not recall that the port of Barus on the northwest coast of Sumatra once exported fine quality camphor and bezoin, harvested by their ancestors.
Archival series such as the Daily Journals of Batavia and the appendices to the Resolution Books contain many fascinating documents bearing witness to the indigenous products of Nusantara. The short list of the cargo of a small Javanese gonting or trading vessel can speak volumes. What about the cargo lists of Chinese junks from Canton, Amoy and Ningpo which came for Timorese sandalwood, wax from Alor or sappan wood from East Java and Sumbawa.
Situated in the middle of the great trading arteries between India and China, Nusantara was always guaranteed the export of the finest products these Asian regions could produce. Porcelain and silk came from China and skillfully handcrafted textiles were imported by traders from India. Sometime the cargo manifest of a single ship tells it all, as the selected documents show.
fields.name: I.5 Trade, Cargoes and Articles

fields.shortIntroText_id: Produk pertanian tradisional Nusantara hingga kini masih dapat diandalkan. Indonesia kini masih memroduksi 75 persen dari produksi pala dunia. Namun, rempah-rempah seperti cengkeh sekarang juga ditanam secara besar-besaran di Madagascar dan Zanzibar. Kayu manis dahulu hanya ditanam di Ceylon, tetapi kini Indonesia (Sumatra Barat) merupakan produsen utamanya. Di tahun 1696, tanaman kopi dimasukkan ke Jawa Barat.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The traditional agricultural products of Nusantara are still famous. Indonesia still produces 75 per cent of the world’s nutmeg. But the fine spices, cloves, are now also grown in great quantities in Madagascar and Zanzibar. Cinnamon used to be grown exclusively in Ceylon, but today Indonesia (West Sumatra) is a main producer. Coffee bushes were imported into West Java in 1696.
fields.shortIntroText: The traditional agricultural products of Nusantara are still famous. Indonesia still produces 75 per cent of the world’s nutmeg. But the fine spices, cloves, are now also grown in great quantities in Madagascar and Zanzibar. Cinnamon used to be grown exclusively in Ceylon, but today Indonesia (West Sumatra) is a main producer. Coffee bushes were imported into West Java in 1696.
fields.name_id: I.5 Perdagangan, Kargo dan Barang Dagangan
fields.longIntroText_id:
Ketika di abad 18 produksi kopi mencapai puncak kejayaannya, Priangan adalah pusatnya namun kini di daerah tersebut nyaris tidak ada tanaman kopi sama sekali dan gema ledakan ekonomi di abad ke delapan belas juga sudah lenyap dari memori kolektif orang-orang Sunda. Begitu pula dengan orang Batak di Sumatra Utara, mereka kini sudah tidak ingat lagi bahwa pelabuhan Barus di pantai barat laut pulau itu pernah mengekspor kapur barus bermutu tinggi yang dipanen nenek moyangnya.
Seri-seri arsip seperti Catatan Harian Kastel Batavia bersama lampiran pada Buku-buku Resolusi berisi banyak dokumen memukau yang berkisah tentang produk-produk asli Nusantara. Gerangan kisah apa pula yang diungkapkan daftar kargo kapal-kapal jung Cina dari Canton, Amoy dan Ningpo yang datang untuk membeli kayu cendana Timor, paraffin dari Alor atau kayu sappan wood dari Jawa Timur dan Sumbawa.
Terletak di tengah-tengah jalur perdagangan utama antara India dan Cina, Nusantara sejak dulu senantiasa menjamin keberlangsungan ekspor produk-produk utama kawasan Asia di sekitarnya. Porselin, sutera dan kain tenunan tangan didatangkan dari Cina oleh para pedagang India. Terkadang, dokumen barang muatan sebuah kapal dapat bercerita begitu banyak, seperti yang telah dipilih dalam koleksi ini.

fields.longIntroText_en:
The first allies of the VOC were Muslim rulers, the enemies of the Portuguese: the radja of Hitu, the sultan of Ternate and the rulers of Johor. Early baptismal registers from former Portuguese establisments such as Labuha (on the island of Bacan in Maluku) show how people with Catholic names mingled with those with Dutch Protestant names. Inter-religious relations between Muslims and Christians in VOC-controlled territories were usually stable and peaceful. The VOC followed a strict policy of ‘Cuius regio, eius religio’: ‘Whose realm, his religion’. Protestant church ministers were never permitted to initiate missionary activities in the territory of a Muslim ruler.
Both communities lived side by side peacefully and not only in VOC-controlled cities and towns like in Batavia, Ambon, and Makassar. The sultans of eighteenth-century Banten had no problem with Christian worship. Such trading towns could be important arenas for religious exchange and dialogue. The Dutch Bible translator the Rev. Melchior Leydekker collected Arab-Malay manuscripts from the scholarly circle around Sjeikh Yusuf in Banten to learn about the formulation and idioms of Islamic theological concepts. This certainly influenced the classic form of Malay Leydekker and others adapted for the first Bible translation into an Asian language, the Leydekker-Werndly edition of 1733 (published in Arabic script in 1758).
Religious activities from both monotheist religions stimulated the spread of Arabic and Malay during the 17th and 18th century. Subsequently the spread of Islam and Christianity, in particular in Eastern Indonesia, also influenced the establishment of schools, the spread of books and literacy.

fields.shortIntroText_id: Awal Kurun Waktu Modern menyaksikan kedatangan serta gelombang penyebaran agama-agama dunia: Islam dan Nasrani. Agama Islam disebarkan secara damai di antara masyarakat pedagang di pesisir Melayu-Indonesia, tempat orang Muslim dari India dan Arab berdagang dan juga berkeluarga. Penyebaran agama Islam juga merupakan jawaban terhadap ekspansi orang Barat, khususnya bangsa Portugis dan kegiatan pekabaran injil Katolik Romawi.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The Early Modern Period witnessed the arrival and propagation of two World religions: Islam and Christianity. The peaceful propagation of Islam in the Malay-Indonesian World began in coastal trading communities where Indian and Arab Muslims had established trading contacts and families. The spread of Islam was partly a response to Western expansion, in particular the Portuguese expansion and Roman Catholic missionary activity.

fields.name_id: I.6 Agama, Kitab Suci, Bahasa dan Buku
fields.name_en: I.6 Religions, Scriptures, Languages and Books
fields.longIntroText_id:
Sekutu-sekutu pertama VOC adalah para penguasa Muslim yang merupakan musuh bangsa Portugis; yaitu raja Hitu, sultan Ternate serta penguasa Johor. Buku pembaptisan pertama di bekas kawasan permukiman Portugis seperti Labuha (di pulau Bacan, Maluku) menunjukkan betapa orang-orang dengan nama-nama Katolik bercampur baur dengan mereka yang menyandang nama-nama Belanda Protestan. Hubungan antar-agama, antara orang-orang Muslim dan Nasrani di dalam teritori yang dikendalikan VOC biasanya berlangsung secara mantap dan damai. VOC secara ketat menjalankan kebijakan ‘Cuius regio, eius religio’; artinya, ‘Setiap kawasan menjalankan agamanya masing-masing’. Pendeta Protestan tidak pernak diizinkan untuk memulai kegiatan pekabaran injil di kawasan penguasa Muslim.
Kedua masyarakat beda agama itu hidup rukun dan damai, tidak hanya di kota-kota yang dikendalikan VOC seperti Batavia, Ambon dan Makassar. Di abad delapan belas, para sultan Banten tidak menjumpai masalah dengan adanya ibadah kaum Kristen. Penerjemah Kitab Injil Belanda yaitu pendeta Melchior Leydekker, menghimpun naskah-naskah berbahasa Arab-Melayu dari para cendekiawan di kalangan Syeik Yusuf di Banten dan mempelajari pembentukan serta ungkapan khas yang terdapat dalam konsep-konsep agama Islam. Hal ini sudah tentu berdampak pada bentuk Kitab Injil yang pertama kali diterjemahkan Leydekker dalam bahasa Melayu, yaitu terbitan Leydekker-Werndly tahun 1773 (yang kemudian terbit dalam aksara Arab dan disadur oleh sejumlah orang).
Kegiatan keagamaan dari kedua agama monoteis tersebut mendorong penyebaran bahasa Arab dan Melayu dalam abad 17 dan 18. Kemudian, penyebaran agama Islam dan Nasrani, khususnya di Indonesia bagian timur, juga memengaruhi pendirian sekolah-sekolah, penyebaran buku dan melek aksara.

fields.longIntroText_en: The Qing dynasty opened its ports to overseas trade again in 1684. The Southeast Asian region profited from the intensified exchange of produce with the Chinese nakhodas. Canton, Amoy and Ningbo also attracted European ships, the English in particular. The ports of Johor, Banjarmasin and Batavia were attrative entrepôts for the exchange of goods. Sticking to their monopolistic policy and suspicious of English captains, the Surpreme Government of Asia gathered copious intelligence about Chinese (overseas) trading activities. But not all documents are of a formal nature or written from a Dutch policy perspective. Batavia also served as a safe haven and legal mediator for many overseas Chinese traders who needed mediation or help in trading disputes. Numerous personal requests make it possible to identify thousands of individual Chinese traders. In particular, the documents which originate from the overseas Chinese themselves offer an impression about many economic activities and social life of many individuals.
fields.name: II.1 China, Japan and Formosa (Taiwan)

fields.shortIntroText_id: Cina dan Jepang, dua negara maritim, sejak dahulu kala sudah berinteraksi dengan Asia. Tembaga Jepang sudah masuk ke India dan porselin Cina sudah diminati di Jawa. Oleh karena kaisar Cina mendeklarasikan pembatasan pada kegiatan perdagangan luar negeri, maka Belanda menduduki beberapa bagian di Formosa (Taiwan) dari 1624 hingga 1662 (penguasaan Tsjeng Tsjeng-kung alias Coxinga atas Benteng Zeelandia).
fields.shortIntroText_en: Maritime China and Japan had interacted with the rest of Asia since time imemorable. Japanese copper found its way to India, and Chinese porcelain to Java. Owing to the overseas trade restrictions imposed by the Chinese emperor, the Dutch occupied parts of Formosa (Taiwan) from 1624-1662 (Tsjeng Tsjeng-kung alias Coxinga’s conquest of Fort Zeelandia).
fields.shortIntroText: Maritime China and Japan had interacted with the rest of Asia since time imemorable. Japanese copper found its way to India, and Chinese porcelain to Java. fields.longIntroText_id:
Di tahun 1684, Dinasti Qing kembali membuka sejumlah pelabuhannya untuk perdagangan luar negeri. Kawasan Asia Tenggara memetik keuntungan dari pertukaran produk yang semakin rancak dilakukan para nakhoda Cina. Canton, Amoy dan Ningbo juga menjadi daya tarik bagi kapal-kapal Eropa, utamanya dari Inggris. Pelabuhan Johor, Banjarmasin dan Batavia merupakan pelabuhan-antara bagi pertukaran barang. Pemerintah Agung di Asia menjalankan kebijakan monopolistik yang ketat dan sangat mencurigai para kapten kapal Inggris dan sebab itu menghimpun banyak sekali informasi intelijen terkait kegiatan perdagangan (luar negeri) Cina. Namun, tidak semua dokumen bersifat resmi atau ditulis dengan sudut pandang kebijakan Belanda. Batavia juga merupakan tempat aman yang menyuguhkan jasa perantaraan hukum bagi sejumlah pedagang Cina dari seberang yang memerlukan mediasi atau bantuan dalam menyelesaikan perselisihan dagang. Dari banyak surat permohonan bantuan pribadi terungkap identitas ribuan pedagang Cina dari seberang. Khususnya dari dokumen-dokumen yang berasal dari pedagang Cina itu sendiri
yang berisi banyak kegiatan ekonomi dan kehidupan sosial pribadi mereka.

fields.longIntroText_en: The Daily Journals of Batavia Castle form one of the most important and coherent sources for the diplomatic relations between the Surpreme Goverment and the rulers of Tonkin and Siam. In particular the insertion in the Daily Journals of hundreds of diplomatic letters that were exchanged between the Governor-Generals and the Kings and Phrakhlang (the Minister of Maritime Trade and External Relations) of Siam, makes this source a unique source for Thai royal history.
fields.name: II.2 Mainland Southeast Asia (Tonkin, Siam, Pegu)
fields.longIntroText: The Daily Journals of Batavia Castle form one of the most important and coherent sources for the diplomatic relations between the Surpreme Goverment and the rulers of Tonkin and Siam. In particular the insertion in the Daily Journals of hundreds of diplomatic letters that were exchanged between the Governor-Generals and the Kings and Phrakhlang (the Minister of Maritime Trade and External Relations) of Siam, makes this source a unique source for Thai royal history.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Sejumlah kerajaan di daratan Asia Tenggara secara tradisional sudah terjalin dalam jejaring perdagangan Nusantara. Di abad 17, Jawa tetap melanjutkan kegiatan dagang tradisionalnya yaitu mengekspor kuda ke Siam, sementara  keluarga-keluarga di Batavia (dan mungkin juga di sejumlah pelabuhan lain) masih terus menggunakan gentong-gentong besar (martaban) yang didatangkan dari Pegu di Myanmar sekarang. Di tahun 1637, Batavia menjalin hubungan dagang langsung dengan kerajaan Tonkin di Vietnam dan dengan Siam di tahun 1604.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Several kingdoms on the mainland were tradionally connected to the trade networks of Nusantara. During the 17th century, Java continued its traditional horse export to Siam, while Batavian households (and perhaps those in other ports as well) still used the import large jars (martaban) from Pegu, presently Myanmar. Batavia established direct trade with the Vietnamese kingdom of Tonkin in 1637, and with Siam in 1604.

fields.name_id: II.2 Daratan Asia Tenggara (Tonkin, Siam, Pegu)
fields.name_en: II.2 Mainland Southeast Asia (Tonkin, Siam, Pegu)
fields.longIntroText_id: Catatan Harian Kastel Batavia merupakan salah satu sumber penting yang dengan runut mengungkapkan perkembangan hubungan diplomatik antara Pemerintah Agung dengan para penguasa Tonkin dan Siam. Khususnya, ratusan surat diplomatik yang disisipkan di dalam Catatan Harian yang berasal dari kegiatan surat-menyurat antara para Gubernur Jenderal dengan para raja serta prakhlang (Menteri Perdagangan Maritim dan Hubungan Luar Negeri) Siam membuat sumber ini berisi informasi sejarah kerajaan Thai yang unik.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Consequentely, the VOC proclaimed an exclusive import monopoly on these two commodities: textiles and opium. By every means in the book – contracts, placards, trading passes, cruising vessels – the VOC strove to maintain this monopoly. Despite this policy of containment, there was invariably an influx of ‘illegal’ opium and textiles.
Besides opium, the Europeans collected another important product in the port city of Houghly (Chinsura) at the mouth of the Ganges River: saltpetre or potassium nitrate (KNO3) which was used in the production of Batavian gunpowder.
The traders from the Coromandel Coast traditionally exported cotton textiles to Southeast Asian via the northern ports of Bheemunipatnam and Masulipatnam (in the kingdom of Golconda). These ports were contested by the Dutch, French en English and declined in the second half of the 18th century.
Ceylon or Sri Lanka was culturally linked to the Coromandel Coast. The Dutch conquered the Portuguese-held ports of Negombo and Gale in 1640 and the main city of Colombo in 1656. They gradually expanded their power along the coastal areas. The inland Buddhist kingdom of Kandy remainded independent until 1766. The principal export products of Ceylon were elephants and cinnamon. Colombo was the second colonial city of the VOC in Asia and maintained strong ties with Batavia. Within the VOC network of empire, Ceylon served as an place of banishment for various Indonesian princes and noblemen who had tried to oust the VOC. The Daily Journals still contain letters of banished Indonesians pleadingto be sent back to their homelands.
fields.name: II.3 The Bay of Bengal, Coromandel Coast, Ceilon

fields.shortIntroText_id: Di abad tujuh belas, kedatangan dua kapal barang bermuatan penuh dengan tekstil India dapat berdampak besar pada seluruh pasar barang impor di Jawa. Tidak banyak konsumen Jawa yang mampu membeli tekstil yang begitu mahal. Selain itu, orang Jawa sendiri juga memroduksi katun dan kain. Sebab itu maka candu yang secara tradisional didatangkan dari Bengala merupakan barang dagangan yang lebih menguntungkan di Asia Tenggara.
fields.shortIntroText_en: In the seventeenth century, two large European cargo ships laden with Indian textiles could make a difference to the total Javanese import market. Not many Javanese consumers could afford such expensive textiles. Besides, the Javanese also produced cotton and cloth themselves. Hence, opium, traditionally imported from Bengal, could be a more lucrative trade item in Southeast Asia.
fields.shortIntroText: In the seventeenth century, two large European cargo ships laden with Indian textiles could make a difference to the total Javanese import market. fields.name_id: II.3 Teluk Benggala, Pantai Koromandel, Sailan
fields.name_en: II.3 The Bay of Bengal, Coromandel Coast, Ceilon
fields.longIntroText_id:
Akibatnya, VOC mengumumkan hak monopoli impor atas dua barang dagangan tersebut: tekstil dan candu. VOC berusaha keras untuk memertahankan monopoli tersebut, dengan memanfaatkan semua cara seperti membuat kontrak, pengumuman tembok, mengeluarkan pas perdagangan dan melakukan patroli dengan kapal. Kendati ada kebijakan pembatasan tersebut, selalu saja ada arus masuk candu dan tekstil ilegal.
Selain candu, orang Eropa juga menghimpun produk impor penting lain di kota pelabuhan Houghly (Chinsura) yang terletak di muara Sungai Gangga yaitu ” sendawa atau potassium nitrate” (KNO3) yang digunakan untuk membuat serbuk senjata Batavia.
Para pedagang dari Pesisir Coromandel secara tradisional mengekspor benang tekstil ke Asia Tenggara melalui sejumlah pelabuhan di utara yaitu Bheemunipatnam dan Masulipatnam (di kerajaan Golconda). Pelabuhan-pelabuhan tersebut kemudian diperebutkan oleh bangsa-bangsa Belanda, Perancis dan Inggris sehingga pamornya surut di paruh kedua abad 18.
Sailan atau Sri Lanka secara kebudayaan terkait dengan Pesisir Coromandel. Di tahun 1656, bangsa Belanda merebut pelabuhan Negombo dan Gale yang sebelumnya dikuasai Portugis. Secara bertahap mereka kemudian mengembangkan kekuasaan di sepanjang kawasan pesisir. Kandy yang merupakan kerajaan Buddha di pedalaman tetap merdeka hingga 1766. Produk utama yang diekspor Sri Lanka adalah gajah dan kayu manis. Colombo merupakan kota jajahan kedua VOC di Asia menjalin hubungan mantap dengan Batavia. Di dalam jejaring kerajaan VOC, Ceylon merupakan tempat pembuangan sejumlah pangeran dan bangsawan Indonesia yang berusaha mengusir VOC. Dalam Catatan Harian masih tersimpan surat-surat dari orang-orang Indonesia yang dibuang itu, memohon agar dapat dipulangkan ke tanah air mereka.

fields.longIntroText_en: Surat served as the headquarters of the English and the Dutch East India Companies for their trading operations in north-western India and the the Arabian Seas. The city held its position of prominence in the Indian Ocean maritime trade until the end of the eighteenth century. On the Malabar Coast, Calicut was the most prominent centre of maritime trade in the early modern period. The Portuguese settled in Goa (1510) and expanded their possessions along the Malabar coast, a pepper producing area. One of the Portuguese towns, Cochin, was conquered by the VOC in 1663. Several smaller strongholds on the Malabar Coast served as military observation posts (naval bases) against pirates and ‘smugglers’, those many small Indian traders avoiding the pepper supply contracts. The Rajas of Cochin and Calicut often made lucrative contracts with the Dutch to deliver pepper from the hinterlands. The daily Journals of Batavia contain some letters of the Rajas of Cochin. The rise of Travancore in the south eventually led to a decline in the pepper supply to Europeans in the late 18th century.
fields.name: II.4 The Arabian Seas, Malabar, Gujurat

fields.shortIntroText_id: Missing text here ....
fields.shortIntroText_en: The Malabar Coast and Gujarat belonged to the trading world of the Arabian seas. This segment of the Indian Ocean had its own trade dynamics, owing to the rhythm of the monsoon winds. In Gujarat, Cambay was the most important port city and a centre of maritime trade in the western Indian Ocean during the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries. In the seventeenth century, Surat (in Gujarat) emerged as the greatest port of the Mughal Empire in western India and played a vital role in linking northern India with the maritime worlds of the Persian Gulf, the Red Sea, and East Africa.
fields.shortIntroText: The Malabar Coast and Gujarat belonged to the trading world of the Arabian seas. This segment of the Indian Ocean had its own trade dynamics, owing to the rhythm of the monsoon winds. In Gujarat, Cambay was the most important port city and a centre of maritime trade in the western Indian Ocean during the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries. In the seventeenth century, Surat (in Gujarat) emerged as the greatest port of the Mughal Empire in western India and played a vital role in linking northern India with the maritime worlds of the Persian Gulf, the Red Sea, and East Africa.
fields.name_en: II.4 The Arabian Seas, Malabar, Gujurat
fields.longIntroText_id: Pantai Malabar beserta sejumlah pelabuhan penting seperti Diu, Cambay dan Surat (di Gujarat) merupakan bagian dari dunia perdagangan di sekitar Laut Arab. Kawasan di Samudra Hindia ini memiliki dinamika perdagangannya sendiri yang tergantung pada arah tiupan angin musim. Bangsa Portugis bermukim di Goa di tahun 1510 dan melebarkan kekuasaannya di sepanjang Pesisir Malabar, sebuah kawasan yang memroduksi lada. Salah satu kota Portugis, Cochin, ditaklukkan VOC di tahun 1663. Sejumlah bangunan pertahanan kecil di sepanjang Pesisir Malabar berfungsi sebagai titik-titik pemantauan untuk mengawasi para perompak dan ‘penyelundup’ yaitu para pedagang kecil India yang berusaha menghindar dari ketentuan dalam kontrak pemasokan lada. Para raja di Cochin dan Calicut seringkali membuat kontrak menguntungkan dengan pihak Belanda untuk mengirim lada dari kawasan hinterland mereka. Dalam Catatan Harian Batavia terdapat beberapa surat yang berasal dari para raja Cochin. Kemajuan Travancore di selatan akhirnya menyurutkan pasokan lada kepada orang-orang Eropa di akhir abad 18.

fields.longIntroText_en:
The Persian connection was not only important to Batavia. The Persian sugar demand was important to the export of sugar produced by mills operating in the Environs of Batavia and on the east coast of Java. Southeast Asian rulers and kings were also interested in maintaining ties with the Persian Gulf as they shared an important hobby: collecting Persian horses. Dried raisins and dates and other luxury foodstuffs were popular items of consumption at the courts.
After the fall of the Safavid dynasty in 1722 after an Afghan invasion, the import of Indonesian sugar and spices, and the export of Iranian silk and gold species declined. Although the Gentlemen 17 in the Dutch Republic decided to close down all trading facilities in the Persian Gulf, Governor-General Jacob Mossel changed this and permitted the former Resident in Basra, Baron T.F. von Kniphausen, to build Fort Mosselstein on the island of Kharq in 1753. A number of sugar ships from Batavia reached Kharq via Masqat, until Mosselstein fell into the hands of a local ruler in 1766, and the whole experiment collapsed. The loss of the sugar ship the Amstelveen on the coast of Oman in 1763 only hastened the decision to leave the Gulf. A decade later, private Dutch traders resumed the sales of sugar and spices, in particular in Masqat.
fields.name: II.5 Persia, the Arabian Peninsula, Madagascar, Mauritius

After the fall of the Safavid dynasty in 1722 after an Afghan invasion, the import of Indonesian sugar and spices, and the export of Iranian silk and gold species declined. Although the Gentlemen 17 in the Dutch Republic decided to close down all trading facilities in the Persian Gulf, Governor-General Jacob Mossel changed this and permitted the former Resident in Basra, Baron T.F. von Kniphausen, to build Fort Mosselstein on the island of Kharq in 1753. A number of sugar ships from Batavia reached Kharq via Masqat, until Mosselstein fell into the hands of a local ruler in 1766, and the whole experiment collapsed. The loss of the sugar ship the Amstelveen on the coast of Oman in 1763 only hastened the decision to leave the Gulf. A decade later, private Dutch traders resumed the sales of sugar and spices, in particular in Masqat.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Pelabuhan tua Arab, al-Mukhā (Mocha) di Yaman, Masqat (Muscat) di Oman dan beberapa pelabuhan di Teluk Persia seperti Bandar Abbas (Gasmron), Bandar-e Rig atau Basra (Ottoman) semuanya terhubung langsung dengan sejumlah pelabuhan dagang di India, utamanya pelabuhan Mogul Surat di Gujarat serta pelabuhan lada seperti Calicut dan Cochin. Kelompok pedagang Arab, Armenia dan Yahudi semuanya memiliki kawasannya masing-masing di kota-kota tersebut. Pelabuhan Nusantara seperti Aceh dan Pariaman (Sumatra), Banten dan Jepara (Jawa) memetik keuntungan dari hubungan langsung dengan kawasan Arab. Secara bertahap, kebijakan monopoli perdagangan menggantikan hubungan lama tersebut.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The old Arabian ports al-Mukhā (Mocha) in Yemen, Masqat (Muscat) in Oman and Persian Gulf ports of Bandar ‘Abbas (Gamron), Bandar-e Rig or Basra (Ottoman) were all directly connected to the trading ports of India, in particular the Mogul port of Surat in Gujerat and the pepper ports of such as Calicut and Cochin. Foreign merchants groups of Arabs, Armenians and Jews all had their own quarters in these towns. The ports of Nusantara, like Aceh and Pariaman (Sumatra), Banten and Jepara (Java), profited from this direct connection with the Arabian world. European trade monopolies gradually replaced these older links.

fields.name_en: II.5 Persia, the Arabian Peninsula, Madagascar, Mauritius
fields.longIntroText_id:
Hubungan dengan Persia ini tidak hanya penting bagi Batavia. Permintaan akan gula Persia berdampak penting bagi ekspor gula yang dihasilkan sejumlah penggilingan di kawasan luar tembok Batavia dan di pantai timur Jawa. Para penguasa dan raja Asia Tenggara juga berminat untuk memelihara hubungan dengan kawasan Teluk Persia karena penduduk kedua kawasan itu berbagi hobi yang sama: mengumpulkan kuda-kuda Persia. Buah kismis dan kurma kering serta sejumlah bahan pangan mewah lain menjadi santapan yang semakin digemari para penghuni di sejumlah keraton.
Menyusul kejatuhan dinasti Safavid di tahun 1722, akibat sebuah penyerbuan oleh Afghanistan, maka impor gula dan rempah-rempah dari Indonesia serta ekspor kain sutra dan emas dari Iran menyusut. Kendati Heren Zeventien yang berkantor di Republik Belanda ketika itu memutuskan untuk menutup semua fasilitas perdagangan di Teluk Persia, Gubernur Jenderal Jacob Mossel mengubah kebijakan tersebut dan mengijinkan mantan Residen di Basra, Baron T.F. von Kniphausen untuk membangun Benteng Mosselstein di pulau Kharq di tahun 1753. Sejumlah kapal bermuatan gula dari Batavia tiba di Kharq melalui Masqat hingga kemudian Mosselstein jatuh ke tangan penguasa setempat di tahun 1766, dan seluruh eksperimen tersebut runtuh. Kehilangan kapal bermuatan gula, Amstelveen di pantai Oman tahun 1763 mempercepat keputusan untuk pergi dari Teluk. Satu dasawarsa kemudian, sejumlah pedagang swasta Belanda kembali memperdagangkan gula dan rempah-rempah utamanya di Masqat.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Agricultural expansion and outbreaks of smallpox epidemics were catastrophic for the original Khoikoi tribes. The influx of thousands of slaves from the East African coast, Madagascar and the Indonesian Archipelago contributed to the growth of a mixed society based on forced labour. In 1795 at the request of Stadholder Willem V, who feared an invasion of the French under Napoleon, a British naval fleet forced the last Dutch governor to surrender.
The connection between Batavia and the Cape was important to the VOC ‘Network of Empire’. The return fleets which sailed from the Sunda Straits to the Cape usually carried dozens of private slaves, convicts or political prisoners. This contributed to the establisment of the first Muslim community in South Africa, which was substantially strengthed by the exiled Makassarese ulama Shaykh Yusuf who lived on the farm Zandvliet (renamed ‘Makassar’) from 1694 until his death in 1699.
fields.name: II.6 The Cape of Good Hope
fields.longIntroText:

fields.shortIntroText_id: Lima puluh tahun sesudah didirikan, VOC membangun sebuah pos perbekalan permanen di Tanjung Harapan, di tahun 1652. Lima tahun kemudian, penanaman sayur-mayur dan peternakan diswastakan sehingga terjadi arus masuk besar dari petani-petani merdeka, yaitu kaum Boer. Tanah jajahan yang dihuni warga bebas itu kemudian berkembang pesat di akhir abad tujuh belas dan sejumlah permukiman baru bermunculan seperti Stellenbosch dan Peral. Di abad delapan belas, kawasan permukiman itu juga berkembang dan empat distrik didirikan: Kaapstad, Stellembosch, Sellendam dan Graaff-Reinet di timur.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Fifty years after its foundation, the VOC established a permanent provisioning station at the Cape of Good Hope in 1652. Five years later, vegetable growing and cattle farming were privatized, leading to a greater influx of independent farmers, the Boeren. This colony of free burghers expanded in the late seventeenth century and founded new settlements like Stellenbosch and Paarl. Settlements also expanded in the eighteenth century and four districts were created: Kaapstad, Stellenbosch, Swellendam and Graaff-Reinet in the east.

fields.name_en: II.6 The Cape of Good Hope
fields.longIntroText_id:
Perkembangan kegiatan pertanian dan merebaknya penyakit cacar yang menular berdampak fatal bagi suku-suku asli Khoikoi. Arus masuk ribuan budak dari pantai Afrika Timur, Madagascar dan Kepulauan Indonesia mendorong pertumbuhan sebuah masyarakat majemuk yang ditopang oleh para pekerja paksa. Di tahun 1795, atas permintaan Wali Negara Willem V yang mengkhawatirkan penyerbuan Perancis di bawah pimpinan Napoleon, sebuah armada angkatan laut Inggris mendesak gubernur terakhir Belanda untuk menyerahkan diri.
Hubungan antara Batavia dengan Tanjung Harapan sangat penting bagi ‘Jejaring Kerajaan’ VOC. Armada-armada yang pulang ke tanah air dan berlayar dari Selat Sunda ke Tanjung Harapan, biasanya mengangkut pula lusinan budak swasta, penjahat serta tawanan politik. Mereka inilah yang merupakan cikal bakal masyarakat Muslim pertama di Afrika Selatan yang kemudian semakin ditumbuh-kembangkan oleh seorang ulama dari Makassar yang dibuang, yaitu Sheik Yusuf yang tinggal di peternakan Zanvliet (kemudian diubah namanya menjadi ‘Makassar’) dari 1694 hingga wafat di tahun 1699.

fields.name: III.1 Trade, Cargoes, and Contracts
fields.shortIntroText_id: Dua seri arsip VOC yang tebal di Jakarta berisi ribuan dokumen tentang perdagangan intra-Asia dan Eropa-Asia. Catatan Harian di Kastel Batavia dimaksudkan untuk mencatat semua kapal Eropa besar beserta muatannya yang masuk dan meninggalkan kota itu. Ribuan kapal kecil kapal 'flute', pergata, kapal berlayar ganda, 'chialoup'  serta jenis kapal-kapal lain terdaftar bersama rincian muatannya. Semua kapal itu beserta daftar muatannya termauk juga ribuan surat permohonan, tagihan, laporan dan surat-surat yang tersembunyi dalam Lampiran Buku-buku Resolusi Pemerintah Agung memberikan pemahaman baru tentang arus barang dalam kegiatan perdagangan antar Asia dan Eropa-Asia.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Two massive series of the VOC archives in Jakarta offer thousands of documents about the intra-Asian and European-Asian trade. The Daily Journals of Batavia Castle were kept to record all large incoming and departing European ships plus their cargoes. Thousands of flute ships, frigates, brigantines, shallops and others types of ships are registered, with short lists of their cargoes. All these ships and cargo listings and tens of thousands of small requests, bills, reports and letters hidden in the Appendices Resolution Books of the Surpreme Government offer new insights into the flow of goods in the intra-Asian and European-Asian trade.

fields.longIntroText_en: As voyages were at the mercy of sudden wind changes and therefore unpredictable duration and direction, crews had to cope with starvation and, if the worst came to the worst, the wreck or foundering of their ships. Several reports on conditions on board, the causes of disease and the wrecking of ships colour this section.
fields.name: III.2 Ships, Crews, Voyages and Wrecks
fields.longIntroText: As voyages were at the mercy of sudden wind changes and therefore unpredictable duration and direction, crews had to cope with starvation and, if the worst came to the worst, the wreck or foundering of their ships. Several reports on conditions on board, the causes of disease and the wrecking of ships colour this section.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Lazimnya, kapal-kapal Eropa beserta awaknya membuang sauh di pangkalan-pangkalan laut dekat pelabuhan-pelabuhan terkenal seperti Colombo, Nagapatnam, Melaka, Batavia, Maccau, Canton dan Deshima; kendati demikian, petualangan untuk menemukan kawasan dan penduduk yang belum dikenal tetap marak dilakukan. Inggris dan Belanda, keduanya mengirim ekspedisi penjajagan ke benua Autralia, seperti yang dilakukan kapal Batavia di tahun 1623 atau pergata Geelvink di tahun 1696, William Dampier dihadapi dengan penuh syak wasangka ketika tiba di Batavia dan semua laporan intel terkait keberadaannya senantiasa dinantikan. Terdapat sejumlah laporan yang mengungkap kawasan yang ketika itu masih belum dikenal.
fields.shortIntroText_en: European ships and crews usually ancored in the roadsteads of well- known ports like Colombo, Negapatnam, Melaka, Batavia, Maccau, Canton and Deshima, but the quest for unknown territories and peoples continued. Both the English and Dutch sent out exploratory expeditions to the Australian continent, like the Batavia in 1623 or the frigate the Geelvink in 1696. William Dampier was met in Batavia with great suspicion and every intelligence report detailing his whereabouts was welcome. Several reports reveal the still unknown world.

fields.name_id: III.2 Kapal, Awak Kapal, Pelayaran dan Kapal Karam
fields.name_en: III.2 Ships, Crews, Voyages and Wrecks
fields.longIntroText_id: Oleh karena pelayaran sangat tergantung pada arah angin yang dapat tiba-tiba berubah, maka lama serta arah pelayaran tidak dapat dipastikan dan sebab itu awak kapal harus mampu mengatasi kelaparan dan dalam keadaan yang paling buruk, mereka juga harus mampu bertahan apabila kapal mereka kandas. Sejumlah laporan tentang kondisi di kapal, penyebab merebaknya penyakit dan kandasnya kapal, semuanya memberi warna tertentu dalam bagian ini.

fields.longIntroText_en: The policy of occupying key positions in the indigenous trading network has left many traces in the landscape. But a fort did not always reflect a strong position. Many small forts and  pagar (a simple earthen defence work with a palisade) represented a symbolic presence meant as a signal to other European powers that the territory was legally under control and their intrusion would be illegal. Various documents will reveal the very different meanings of a foreign physical presence.
fields.name: III.3 Conquests, Fortresses and Occupations
fields.longIntroText: The policy of occupying key positions in the indigenous trading network has left many traces in the landscape. But a fort did not always reflect a strong position. Many small forts and  pagar (a simple earthen defence work with a palisade) represented a symbolic presence meant as a signal to other European powers that the territory was legally under control and their intrusion would be illegal. Various documents will reveal the very different meanings of a foreign physical presence.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Penaklukan pertama di tahun 1605 oleh VOC adalah kota Ambon yang dibangun bangsa Portugis; penaklukan tersebut dimungkinkan berkat bantuan yang sangat diperlukan dari raja Muslim dari Hitu. Oleh karena VOC terutama adalah sebuah badan perdagangan, maka pendudukan yang makan banyak biaya tidak merupakan prioritas pertamanya. Namun demikian, monopoli atas sejumlah komoditi ekspor penting dari Nusantara hanya dapat dipastikan dengan menggunakan kekerasan, menduduki pelabuhan serta pusat perdagangan penting seperti Jayakarta (Batavia) yang terletak dekat pelabuhan utama Banten, begitu pula Makassar, Banda, Jepara dan Surabaya.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The first land conquest by the VOC was the Portuguese-built town of Ambon in 1605, achieved with the indispensable help of the Muslim raja of Hitu. As the VOC was primarily a trading organization, expensive occupations were not in its first priority. Yet, a monopoly on the most important export items of Nusantara could only be secured by violent means, the occupation of key ports and trading centres like Jayakarta (Batavia) near the main port of Banten, as well as Makasser, Banda, Jepara and Surabaya.
fields.shortIntroText: The first land conquest by the VOC was the Portuguese-built town of Ambon in 1605, achieved with the indispensable help of the Muslim raja of Hitu. As the VOC was primarily a trading organization, expensive occupations were not in its first priority. Yet, a monopoly on the most important export items of Nusantara could only be secured by violent means, the occupation of key ports and trading centres like Jayakarta (Batavia) near the main port of Banten, as well as Makasser, Banda, Jepara and Surabaya.
fields.longIntroText_id: Kebijakan menduduki lokasi-lokasi kunci dalam jejaring perdagangan bumiputra telah meninggalkan banyak jejak dalam bentangan kawasan. Namun, yang disebut benteng tidak selalu merupakan kubu yang kokoh, Terdapat banyak benteng kecil serta ‘pagar’ (struktur pertahanan sederhana dari tanah dengan pagar kayu); semuanya merupakan pertanda kepada pihak Eropa bahwa lahan di sekitarnya resmi dikuasai seseorang dan sebab itu apabila mereka tetap memasukinya maka berarti sudah melakukan pelanggaran. Sejumlah dokumen mengungkapkan aneka ragam makna terkait kehadiran pihak asing.

fields.longIntroText_en: What form did anti-colonial resistance take? In many sources resistance, like Surapati’s uprising in Central Java, appears to be a local or regional phenomenon. Wider resistance came from prominent political Muslim leaders such as Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa of Banten (1651-1683) who promoted the Ummah Islam, a supra-regional (also political) community of believers. Some of their letters have been preserved and reveal their intentions and motivations.
fields.name: III.4 Wars, Resistance and Opposition
fields.longIntroText: What form did anti-colonial resistance take? In many sources resistance, like Surapati’s uprising in Central Java, appears to be a local or regional phenomenon. Wider resistance came from prominent political Muslim leaders such as Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa of Banten (1651-1683) who promoted the Ummah Islam, a supra-regional (also political) community of believers. Some of their letters have been preserved and reveal their intentions and motivations.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Apa makna penting teknologi serta organisasi militer Barat bagi interaksi Asia-Eropa? Dibandingkan dengan peperangan dan krisis di Eropa pada abad tujuh belas, maka aksi militer serdadu-pedagang Eropa di Asia dapat dikatakn tidak berarti sama sekali, namun oleh karena mereka memiliki peralatan militer yang jauh lebih tangguh, pengetahuan serta latihan yang juga jauh lebih mantap, maka sejumlah kecil serdadu Eropa mampu menentukan arah sebuah peperangan. Selain itu, dalam kawasan Asia yang penuh perpecahan maka orang Eropa selalu mungkin mendapatkan sekutu di antara para raja setempat. Bagaimana bentuk perlawanan menentang penjajahan?
fields.shortIntroText_en: How important was Western military technology and organization to the Asian-European interaction? In comparison with the European wars and crises in the seventeenth century, the military actions of the European merchant-warriors in Asia seem almost trivial but owing to their far better military equipment, knowledge and drill, small numbers of European soldiers could make a difference in a battle. Besides, in the divided world of the various Asian regions it was always possible to find an ally among local kings.
fields.shortIntroText: How important was Western military technology and organization to the Asian-European interaction? In comparison with the European wars and crises in the seventeenth century, the military actions of the European merchant-warriors in Asia seem almost trivial but owing to their far better military equipment, knowledge and drill, small numbers of European soldiers could make a difference in a battle. Besides, in the divided world of the various Asian regions it was always possible to find an ally among local kings.
fields.longIntroText_id: Dalam banyak sumber terungkap bahwa bentuk perlawanan, seperti pemberontakan Surapati di Jawa Tengah, nampaknya merupakan fenomena regional belaka. Perlawanan yang lebih besar dari para pemimpim politik Muslim seperti Sultan Ageng Tirtayasa dari Banten (1652-1683), yang mengembangkan pendirian sebuah Ummah Islam, yaitu komunitas penganut agama(dan juga politik) yang bersifat supra-regional. Beberapa surat mereka telah dilestarikan dan mencerminkan maksud tujuan serta motivasi mereka.

fields.longIntroText_en: This Western policy of ‘contractual commitment’ not only secured trading monopolies, it also saved numerous small kingdoms and island villages from being overwhelmed by their neighbours. Inter-village violence, piracy and raiding, feudal relations between rulers and vassals, all contributed to an atmosphere in which any Western power could easily gain entry to the Asian scene. Batavia was the main centre of diplomacy. Envoys from the Nusantara sultans, kings and princes were all received with honour, the appropriate protocol and a pleasant ride through the city in a carriage with horses. Letters were exchanged on a silver salver covered with yellow silk cloth. Thousands of diplomatic letters were read aloud in the presence of the Surpreme Government and, after translation, inserted in the Daily Journals of Batavia Castle. One of the most important series of hidden diplomatic letters is those from the kings of Siam and the prhaklang, the Minister of Foreign Relations, and the letters of the Susuhunan of Surakarta in Central Java.
fields.name: III.5 Co-operations, Relations and Diplomacy
fields.longIntroText: This Western policy of ‘contractual commitment’ not only secured trading monopolies, it also saved numerous small kingdoms and island villages from being overwhelmed by their neighbours. Inter-village violence, piracy and raiding, feudal relations between rulers and vassals, all contributed to an atmosphere in which any Western power could easily gain entry to the Asian scene. Batavia was the main centre of diplomacy. Envoys from the Nusantara sultans, kings and princes were all received with honour, the appropriate protocol and a pleasant ride through the city in a carriage with horses. Letters were exchanged on a silver salver covered with yellow silk cloth. Thousands of diplomatic letters were read aloud in the presence of the Surpreme Government and, after translation, inserted in the Daily Journals of Batavia Castle. One of the most important series of hidden diplomatic letters is those from the kings of Siam and the prhaklang, the Minister of Foreign Relations, and the letters of the Susuhunan of Surakarta in Central Java.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Unsur krusial lain dalam perjumpaan Asia-Eropa adalah ritual diplomasi, pertukaran hadiah, protokol militer yang diselenggarakan pada kunjungan diplomatik serta pembubuhan segel pada kontrak. Seri yang trerdiri dari ratusan kontrak yang dibuat antara VOC dengan para penguasa Asia masih tersimpan baik di ANRI, tetapi bagian terbesarnya sudah diterbitkan dalam ‘Corpus Diplomaticum Neerlando-Indicum’.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Another crucial element in the Asian-European encounter was ritual diplomacy, the exchange of gifts, military protocol during diplomatic visits and the sealing of political and trading contracts. The original series of hundreds of contracts between the VOC and Asian rulers is still kept in ANRI, but for the greater part has been published in the ‘Corpus Diplomaticum Neerlando-Indicum’.
fields.shortIntroText: Another crucial element in the Asian-European encounter was ritual diplomacy, the exchange of gifts, military protocol during diplomatic visits and the sealing of political and trading contracts. The original series of hundreds of contracts between the VOC and Asian rulers is still kept in ANRI, but for the greater part has been published in the ‘Corpus Diplomaticum Neerlando-Indicum’.
fields.longIntroText_id: Kebijakan Barat untuk mengadakan ‘kontrak perjanjian’ tidak hanya dimaksudkan untuk menjamin keberlangsungan monopoli perdagangan, melainkan juga untuk menyelamatkan sejumlah kerajaan kecil dan desa di kepulauan dari serbuah tetangga mereka. Gelombang kekerasan antar desa, perompakan dan penjarahan, perseteruan antara para penguasa dengan bawahannya, semua itu turut menciptakan suasana yang memudahkan kekuatan Barat mana pun untuk turut berperan dalam kancah politik Asia. Batavia merupakan pusat utama diplomasi. Utusan dari para sultan Nusantara, raja dan pangeran semuanya diterima dengan segala hormat, sesuai protokol dan dilanjutkan perjalanan keliling kota dengan kereta berkuda. Surat-surat diserah-terimakan dalam nampan perak bertilamkan sutra kuning. Ribuan surat diplomatik dibacakan dengan lantang di hadapan para pejabat Pemerintah Agung dan, sesudah diterjemahkan, dicatat dan dimasukkan dalam Catatan Harian Kastel Batavia. Salah satu dari seri penting surat-surat diplomatik yang terimpan adalah yang berasal dari para raja Siam serta prhaklang, yaitu Menteri Hubungan Luar Negeri, serta surat-surat dari Susuhunan Surakarta di Jawa Tengah.

fields.longIntroText_en:
In the seventeenth century science supported the religious belief that hailed (and did not doubt) God’s Creation. At an early stage, scholars at Leiden University ordered all sorts of plants and rare animals for its collections. The purpose was to expand knowledge of Natural History. Private persons, such as the trader Everhardus Rumphius in Ambon, collected items like seashells. During the eighteenth century, science was often driven by economic exploitation. Geological research, for instance, helped to locate gold- and tin-mines or sulphur pits.
More difficult to trace is the exchange of technology on the practical level. Javanese shipbuilding, for instance, influenced the use of flat-bottomed ships of the pencalang type by European merchants and companies. Chinese knowledge of sugar-milling and refining made Batavia profitable for many investors. European (mathematical) knowledge associated with house and (fort) construction influenced the lifestyle of the Asian elite. Everyday contracts and paper deals in the archives reflect in many ways the small-scale exchange of knowledge and know-how.
fields.name: III.6 Transfer of Technology
fields.longIntroText:
In the seventeenth century science supported the religious belief that hailed (and did not doubt) God’s Creation. At an early stage, scholars at Leiden University ordered all sorts of plants and rare animals for its collections. The purpose was to expand knowledge of Natural History. Private persons, such as the trader Everhardus Rumphius in Ambon, collected items like seashells. During the eighteenth century, science was often driven by economic exploitation. Geological research, for instance, helped to locate gold- and tin-mines or sulphur pits.
More difficult to trace is the exchange of technology on the practical level. European (mathematical) knowledge associated with house and (fort) construction influenced the lifestyle of the Asian elite. fields.shortIntroText_id: Salah satu pengaruh yang berkepanjangan dalam perjumpaan Asia-Eropa adalah pertukaran pengetahuan dan teknologi. Dalam arsip kita menemukan sebuah pesanan untuk sepasang kaca mata bagi seorang penguasa atau pedagang Asia. Memanglah, kemampuan untuk membaca sangat penting untuk dapat memertahankan hidup yang produktip. Jam, bola dunia dan peta serta buku-buku cetakan semuanya turut menghantar Era Global.
fields.shortIntroText_en: One of the most enduring influences in the Asian-European encounter was the exchange of knowledge and technology. In the archives one comes across an order for a pair of spectacles from an Asian ruler or trader. The ability to read was extremely important in maintaining a productive life. Clock, globes and maps and printed books all contributed to the introduction of a Global Era.

fields.longIntroText_id:
Di abad tujuh belas, ilmu pengetahuan mendukung kepercayaan agama dengan mengelu-elukan Ciptaan Tuhan (tidak meragukannya). Pada tahap awal, cendekiawan di Universitas Leiden memesan aneka tanaman serta binatang langka untuk ditambahkan pada koleksi mereka. Tujuannya adalah untuk memperluas pengetahuan tentang Sejarah Alam. Orang-orang swasta seperti pedagang Everhardus Rumphius di Ambon mengoleksi benda-benda seperti kerang laut. Selama abad delapan belas, ilmu pengetahuan sering didorong oleh eksploatasi ekonomis. Penelitian geologi misalnya, membantu orang menemukan ladang-ladang emas dan timah atau sumber-sumber belerang.
Yang lebih sukar adalah untuk merunut pertukaran teknologi pada tataran praktis. Tehnik pembangunan kapal Jawa misalnya, memengaruhi penggunaan kapal dengan dasar datar, seperti jenis kapal pencalang yang dibuat oleh para pedagang dan perusahaan Eropa. Pengetahuan orang Cina terkait penggilingan tebu dan kilang gula membuat Batavia sebagai tempat menguntungkan bagi banyak investor. Pengetahuan (matematika) Eropa terkait pembangunan rumah dan benteng berpengaruh pada gaya hidup kaum elite Asia. Kontrak dan dokumen sederhana yang terdapat dalam arsip mencerminkan aneka cara pengalihan teknologi dan ketrampilan.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Public administration and law and order was also directly supported by various notary’s (lawyer’s) offices, producing thousands of wills, contracts, agreements, affidavits and so forth. A District Council supervised the Environs of the city. Both the College of Alderman and the District Council divided the city into blocks and neighbourhoods, each under its own head. A meticulous population administration helped to maintain a good overview of so many different ethnic groups.
The Batavian Church Council administered four churches which had some 5,000 members around 1700. Superintending private and public behaviour and maintaining strict norms, religion played an important part in a local Christianization and civilization process. Muslim activities are more difficult to trace in the documents, but undoubtedly among the Asian population (90 per cent of the total population) Islam was an important force, in particular, among the people living in the Environs. The majority of the Chinese maintained their own Buddhist and Taoist rituals, for instance, their shadow plays, on occasion in the streets of the town.
fields.name: IV.1 Urban Boards, Public Order, Rebellions

fields.shortIntroText_id: Memerintah dan mengelola sebuah kota berpenduduk multi etnis dan multi bahasa dan dihuni sekitar 100.000 penduduk di akhir abad tujuh belas, benar-benar merupakan tantangan besar. Sejumlah dewan kota didirikan yang bertanggung jawab menjaga ketertiban dan keamanan, mengurus administrasi kepemilikan, mengurus perkawinan dan merawat yatim piatu serta kaum miskin. Dewan Alderman atau Dewan Para Tetua (1617-1811) merupakan lembaga umum terpenting dan berkantor di balai kota yang hingga kini masih berdiri di tengah kota lama Jakarta.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Governing and administering a multi-ethnic and multi-lingual town of around 100,000 inhabitants at the end of the seventeenth century was a real challenge. Various urban boards were appointed to be responsible for law and order, surveying and property administration, matrimonial affairs, and the care of orphans and the poor. The College of Alderman (1617-1811) was the most important body. It was housed in the town hall which is still located in the middle of the old town.

fields.name_id: IV.1 Dewan Perkotaan, Ketertiban Umum, Pemberontakan
fields.name_en: IV.1 Urban Boards, Public Order, Rebellions
fields.longIntroText_id:
Melaksanakan administrasi masyrakat serta menjaga kepatuhan pada hukum dan ketertiban secara langsung juga didukung oleh keberadaan sejumlah kantor notaris (ahli hukum) yang memroduksi ribuan surat wasiat, kontrak, perjanjian, surat sumpah dan lain sebagainya. Ada sebuah Dewan Distrik yang mengurus kawasan di sekitar kota. Bersama dengan Dewan Alderman Dewan Distrik membagi kota dalam beberapa blok dan lingkungan, dengan pemimpinnya masing-masing. Melalui administrasi kependudukan yang rapi maka diperoleh gambaran baik terkait banyak kelompok etnis yang berbeda-beda itu.
Sekitar tahun 1700, Dewan Gereja Batavia mengelola empat gereja dengan sekitar 5.000 jemaat. Agama memainkan peran penting dalam proses Kristianisasi serta pembentukan peradaban penduduk perkotaan dengan mengawasi perilaku pribadi dan umum serta menerapkan norma-norma ketat. Lebih sukar untuk menelusur kegiatan kaum Muslim di dalam dokumen-dokumen, kendati demikian, tidak diragukan lagi bahwa Islam merupakan kekuatan penting bagi penduduk Asia (yang 90% beragama Islam), utamanya mereka yang tinggal di kawasan sekitar kota. Sementara itu, mayoritas penduduk Cina tetap mematuhi ajaran serta upacara agma Buddha dan Tao dengan terkadang misalnya, menggelar sandiwara jalan-jalan kota.

fields.longIntroText_en:
ANRI preserves 161 volumes of collected placards posted by different institutions. Large parts of this collection were published in 17 volumes by the Batavian Society for  the  Arts and Sciences between 1885 – 1900. Although many placards issued concern the city of Batavia, a large number were also intended to be posted in other VOC settlements.

A selection of placards reveals how a colonial local government formulated laws to control an Asian population. These documents show how colonial attitudes and mind-sets are reflected in the promulgation of laws. Also, placards (apart from their original purpose) offer information about Asian social life in a colonial context.
Despite intensive urban political and religious governance, public order disturbances, even large-scale rebellions erupted. Half the population consisted of slaves of different origins. It took little incentive for the slave population and a poor under class of freed Asians and Chinese immigrants to run amuck, not to mention drunken soldiers and sailors on sprees or self-proclaimed leaders such like Capitain Jonker. Various military civil guards patrolled the streets by day and by night. A large-scale Chinese revolt in 1740 led to widespread bloodshed. A report by a military captian shows how fiercely the Chinese sugar laborours rebelled in Tangerang, west of the city.
fields.name: IV.2 Laws and Regulations

fields.shortIntroText_id: Pemerintah Agung, Dewan Kehakiman serta Dewan Tetua (Alderman) bertanggung jawab membuat dan menyebar-luaskan plakat yaitu pengumuman bagi masyarakat luas terkait peraturan, pengambilan sumpah, statuta, instruksi, aturan, pemberitahuan, resolusi dan hukum. Plakat juga dipakai untuk menunjuk tempat-tempat umum di mana diletakkan dokumen-dokumen yang berguna bagi kepentingan bersama. Plakat seringkali diterjemahkan dalam bahasa Jawa, Cina dan Melayu serta ditempelkan di pintu-pintu gedung umum atau di papan-papan khusus yang ditempatkan di sudut-sudut jalan yang banyak dilalui orang.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The Surpreme Government, the Council of Justice and the College of Alderman were responsible for issuing placards. Placards is a collective term for public announcements, ordinances, public oaths, statutes, instructions, rules, notifications, resolutions and laws. Placard can also refer to the posting of documents of public interest in public places. These placards were often translated into Javanese, Chinese and Malay and nailed to the doors of public buildings or special boards at the corners of the busiest streets.
fields.shortIntroText: The Surpreme Government, the Council of Justice and the College of Alderman were responsible for issuing placards. Placards is a collective term for public announcements, ordinances, public oaths, statutes, instructions, rules, notifications, resolutions and laws. Placard can also refer to the posting of documents of public interest in public places. These placards were often translated into Javanese, Chinese and Malay and nailed to the doors of public buildings or special boards at the corners of the busiest streets.
fields.longIntroText_id:
ANRI melestarikan 161 jilid plakat yang dipernah dikeluarkan oleh berbagai lembaga. Banyak dari koleksi tersebut diterbitkan dalam 17 jilid oleh Perikatan Batavia untuk Seni dan Ilmu Pengetahuan antara 1885 – 1900. Kendati banyak plakat yang dibuat terkait kota Batavia, ada banyak juga yang untuk ditempelkan di kawasan permukiman VOC lain di luar Batavia.
Dengan mencermati sejumlah plakat yang terseleksi, kita akan mengetahui bagaimana pemerintah setempat merumuskan undang-undang untuk mengendalikan penduduk Asia. Dari dokumen-dokumen tersebut kita memperoleh gambaran bagaimana sikap dan pandangan kolonial seperti yang tercerminkan dalam penyebar-luasan hukum dan undang-undang. Selain demi untuk tujuan awalnya, maka plakat juga memberikan informasi tentang kehidupan sosial Asia dalam bingkai jajahan.
Kendati ada pengaturan politik serta agama di perkotaan, masih tercetus pula kerusuhan umum bahkan pemberontakan berskala besar. Separuh penduduk merupakan budak-budak dengan berbagai latar belakang. Hanya diperlukan percikan kecil untuk mengubah para budak serta warga Asia bebas dalam kelas sosial paling bawah serta para imigran Cina menjadi kelompok beringas yang mengamuk; belum lagi para serdadu dan kelasi mabuk yang sedang berhura-hura atau orang-orang yang menokohkan diri mereka sendiri seperti Kapitan Jonker. Berbagai kelompok militer dan pertahanan sipil siang dan malam berpatroli di jalan-jalan. Sebuah pemberontakan skala besar orang-orang Cina meletus di tahun 1740 yang berujung pada pembantaian besar-besaran. Dari sebuah laporan yang ditulis seorang kapten militer kita mengetahui betapa keras para pekerja Cina di penggilingan tebu melancarkan pemberontakan sengit di Tangerang, di sebelah barat kota.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Two execution places, one in front of Batavia Castle and one in front of the town hall, were the daily site of brandings, the cutting off of ears and noses, hanging, drawing and quartering, breaking and stretching on the rack, beheading and other painful deaths carried out by professional executioners and hangmen.
Crime and punishment in Batavia is a theme which has not yet been researched by historians. The documents selected from the criminal records detail different crimes perpetrated by different peoples. The key question will be whether or not the implementation of European and colonial law was discriminatory or not, and to what extent and when? And also in how far were crime and punisment related to the particular form of slavery and its excesses in Batavia?
fields.name: IV.4 Crimes, Justice and Punishment
fields.longIntroText:

fields.shortIntroText_id: Kancah kejahatan di Batavia serta hukuman yang ketika itu diterapkan terhadap sejumlah orang mungkin dirasakan terlalu mengerikan oleh pengamat masa kini. Apabila kita membaca catatan kriminal tertua yang dibuat Dewan Tetua, maka kita mungkin berasumsi bahwa di Batavia sangat mudan dan sering terjadi pembunuhan, pemerkosaan, penculikan, peracunan, pencurian, penyerangan serta pertempuran antar kesatuan serdadu dan tawuran di jalan.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The Batavian crime scene and the contemporary punishments meted out to various individuals seem very harsh to the modern observer. Murder, rape, kidnapping, poisoning, theft,  assault and battery and street fights seem to have been pretty rampant when one reads the oldest criminal records of the College of Alderman. Capital punishment had to be approved by the Surpreme Goverment, after which it was quickly registered in the Daily Journals of Batavia.
fields.shortIntroText: The Batavian crime scene and the contemporary punishments meted out to various individuals seem very harsh to the modern observer. Capital punishment had to be approved by the Surpreme Goverment, after which it was quickly registered in the Daily Journals of Batavia.
fields.longIntroText_id:
Hukuman mati harus mendapat persetujuan Pemerintah Agung dan kemudian ditulis dalam Catatan Harian Batavia. Di zaman itu, ada dua tempat dilangsungkannya hukuman mati; satu di depan Kastel Batavia dan satu lagi di depan Balai Kota. Kedua lokasi itu merupakan tempat di mana setiap hari orang dapat menonton badan nara pidana disetempel dengan besi membara, telinga dan hidung mereka dipotong, atau mereka digantung, badan mereka ditarik serta dipatahkan, dipancung serta aneka macam hukuman mati yang mengerikan; semuanya dilaksanakan oleh algojo dan tukang gantung profesional.
Kejahatan dan hukuman di Batavia merupakan sebuah tema yang belum diteliti oleh para sejarawan. Dokumen-dokumen yang diseleksi bercerita tentang berbagai macam kejahatan yang dilakukan orang dari berbagai latar belakang. Pertanyaan kunci adalah, apakah penerapan hukum Eropa dan kolonial itu dilaksanakan secara tebang pilih, dan sejauh mana serta kapan. Selain itu, sejauh mana kejahatan dan hukuman terkait dengan sebuah bentuk perbudakan tertentu serta eksesnya di Batavia?

fields.longIntroText_en:
The economy and labour force in Batavia largely depended on the use of forced labour or thousands of slaves. Half the city consisted of slaves, the majority imported from the tradional slave markets of Nusantara in Sulawesi and from Bali and thesoutheastward islands. Most slaves were privately owned and most private owners were Asian citizens and small agricultural entrepreneurs.
The local economy in the Environs included the production of sugar, rice and a variety of vegetables and fruit. Thousands of little contracts between horticulturalists and workers, traders and producers bear witness to the industriousness of the ‘orang Betawi’, the free (Muslim) Asians of varying descent. The free (Christian) Asians of mainly Indian descent, the Mardijkers, were active landowners and traders, many of whom lived in their own quarter just east of the city walls, and in some kampongs like Tugu and Depok. An early list of landowners reveals the identity of the inhabitants of late-seventeenth century Tugu.
fields.name: IV.5 Economy, Labour and Slavery
fields.longIntroText:
The economy and labour force in Batavia largely depended on the use of forced labour or thousands of slaves. Half the city consisted of slaves, the majority imported from the tradional slave markets of Nusantara in Sulawesi and from Bali and thesoutheastward islands. Most slaves were privately owned and most private owners were Asian citizens and small agricultural entrepreneurs.
The local economy in the Environs included the production of sugar, rice and a variety of vegetables and fruit. Thousands of little contracts between horticulturalists and workers, traders and producers bear witness to the industriousness of the ‘orang Betawi’, the free (Muslim) Asians of varying descent. The free (Christian) Asians of mainly Indian descent, the Mardijkers, were active landowners and traders, many of whom lived in their own quarter just east of the city walls, and in some kampongs like Tugu and Depok. An early list of landowners reveals the identity of the inhabitants of late-seventeenth century Tugu.
fields.shortIntroText_id: Ekonomi Batavia secara kasar dapat dibagi dalam dua kategori: kegiatan bisnis dan pertokoan di dalam kota, serta pertanian dan industri pedesaan di kawasan luar kota. Di atas semua itu masih ada sejumlah kegiatan VOC yaitu pengangkutan barang di pelabuhan, pengelolaan pergudangan, logistik, perbaikan dan pemeliharaan kapal-kapal. Beberapa kontrak yang dibuat antara pemilik kapal swasta dan para investor bercerita tentang jangkauan yang boleh diarungi dunia usaha maritim swasta.
fields.shortIntroText_en: The Batavian economy was roughly divided into two categories: businesses and shops in the city and agriculture and rural industry in the Environs of the city. And, on top of these, the busy activities of the VOC: transportation of goods in the harbour, warehouse management, logistics, repair and maintenance of ships. Some contracts between private shipowners and investors tell us about the scope permitted private maritime enterprises.
fields.shortIntroText: The Batavian economy was roughly divided into two categories: businesses and shops in the city and agriculture and rural industry in the Environs of the city. And, on top of these, the busy activities of the VOC: transportation of goods in the harbour, warehouse management, logistics, repair and maintenance of ships. Some contracts between private shipowners and investors tell us about the scope permitted private maritime enterprises.
fields.longIntroText_id:
Ekonomi dan perburuhan di Batavia sebagian besar bergantung pada pemanfaatan tenaga kerja paksa atau ribuan budak. Separuh penduduk kota adalah budak yang mayoritasnya didatangkan dari pasar-pasar budak tradisional Nusantara di Sulawesi dan Bali serta pulau-pulau di sebelah tenggara. Kebanyakan budak merupakan milik pribadi dan sebagian besar pemiliknya adalah warga Asia serta usahawan kecil di bidang pertanian.
Ekonomi setempat di kawasan luar kota termasuk pula produksi gula, beras dan sejumlah sayur mayur dan buah-buahan. Ribuan kontrak kecil yang dibuat antara para pemilik lahan pertanian dan pekerja, antara para pedagang dan produsen semuanya menjadi saksi betapa rajin ‘orang Betawi’, yaitu warga Asia bebas (Muslim) dari berbagai keturunan. Warga Asia bebas yang beragama Nasrani kebanyakan keturunan India, para Mardiker, yang merupakan pemilik lahan dan pedagang yang aktip dan banyak di antara mereka tinggal dalam lingkungannya masing-masing di sebelah timur di luar tembok kota dan sejumlah lagi di kampong-kampong Tugu dan Depok. Dengan mempelajari daftar pemilik lahan kita dapat mengetahui identitas para penduduk Tugu yang hidup di akhir abad tujuh belas.

fields.longIntroText_en:
Information on public and Company buildings such as the Castle complex, VOC warehouses, the town hall, churches, the orphanage and hospital, can be found in the Resolution Books of the Surpreme Government along with drawings. One example is the list of building materials for the ‘Portuguese’ church outside the city walls (nowadays ‘Gereja Sion’). Private houses and estates were usually built after drawing up a private contract, often at a notary’s office.
The documentation is not limited to the outward appearance and design of the houses. Thousands of wills of private house owners, big and small, record the inventories of peoples belongings, from the reception room of the house decorated with weapons, to dresses and shirts in the bedroom cupboards to the pots and pans in the kitchens. As the documents show, a variety of Indian, Chinese, Dutch and Javanese textiles and cloths is summed up in those private documents, as well as jewellery, artefacts, paintings, writing utensils, books and the inevitable betel boxes. Furniture is also listed in these documents, from bamboo couches to ebony chairs and tables. Asian-European material culture is a well- documented, a rich topic for specialists in these matters.
The material culture of Batavia in all its wealth and variety is an important field of study as many traders and private persons from the length and breadth of the Indonesian Archipelago who came to do business and shop in Batavia, ended up imitating the latest fashions from India, China, and Europe.
fields.name: IV.6 Buildings, Estates, Houses and Interiors

fields.shortIntroText_id: Rumah-rumah Batavia mencerminkan campuran gaya arsitektur Belanda abad tujuh belas dan delapan belas serta pengaruh Asia. Beberapa rumah jelas mirip dengan rumah di Belanda, tetapi diberi cat aneka warna. Khusus orang Cina, yang sudah terbiasa membangun dengan batu bata dan adukan semen dan menggunakan pula plesteran, mereka juga memengaruhi panorama jalan di kota dengan rumah-rumah mereka yang bergaya khas membingkai di tepi jalan. Hiasan di bagian atas dinding samping serta atap yang berpenopang serta beranda kecil di depan merupakan ciri khas rumah mereka.
fields.shortIntroText_en: Batavian houses showed a mix of Dutch seventeenth- and eighteenth-century architectural styles and Asian influences. Some houses were decidedly Dutch but painted in a variety of colours. The Chinese especially, who were used to building with bricks and mortar an using plaster washes, also influenced the street scene with their houses aligned along the street. Ornamentation on the top of the side walls and a roof with cantilevers and small verandas at the front characterized their houses.
fields.shortIntroText: Batavian houses showed a mix of Dutch seventeenth- and eighteenth-century architectural styles and Asian influences. The Chinese especially, who were used to building with bricks and mortar an using plaster washes, also influenced the street scene with their houses aligned along the street. fields.name_id: IV.6 Bangunan, Lahan Permukiman, Perumahan dan Harta Milik
fields.name_en: IV.6 Buildings, Estates, Houses and Interiors
fields.longIntroText_id:
Informasi seputar bangunan umum dan milik Kompeni seperti komplek Kastel, gudang-gudang VOC, balai kota, gereja, balai yatim piatu dan rumah sakit – semuanya dapat kita peroleh dalam Buku-buku Resolusi Pemerintah Agung, termasuk gambar-gambarnya. Salah satu contoh adalah daftar bahan bangunan yang dipergunakan untuk membangun gereja Portugis yang terletak di luar tembok kota (kini dikenal sebagai ‘Gereja Sion’) Rumah pribadi dan rumah perkebunan biasanya dibangun sesudah ditandatangani kontrak yang dibuat di kantor notaris.
Yang dicatat tidak hanya tampak depan tetapi juga rancang bangun rumah. Ribuan surat wasiat dari para pemilik rumah, baik besar atau kecil, merinci barang-barang apa saja yang dimiliki penghuni rumah, mulai dari pajangan di ruang tamu yang lazim dihias dengan aneka jenis senjata, hingga ke busana dan baju dalam almari di kamar tidur serta aneka panci piring di dapur. Dokumen-dokumen itu juga mengungkap aneka kain tekstil dari India, Cina, Belanda dan Jawa dan juga perhiasan, artefak, lukisan, peralatan tulis, buku dan yang pasti selalu ada ialah perlengkapan makan pinang-sirih. Perabotan juga dicatat dalam dokumen-dokumen itu, mulai dari tempat tidur rotan hingga ke kursi dan meja dari kayu eboni. Sejatinya, kebudayaan material Asia-Eropa semuanya tercatat rapi dan merupakan topik yang sarat makna bagi mereka yang mengkhususkan diri di bidang ini.
Budaya material Batavia, yang kaya dan sangat beragam itu merupakan bidang studi penting mengingat banyak pedagang dan orang perorangan dari seluruh pelosok Kepulauan Indonesia datang dan melakukan bisnis dan membuka toko di Batavia; semuanya meniru mode mutahir dari India, Cina dan Eropa.

Daftar yang dapat diperiksa kebenarannya tentang nama-nama dan kepala-kepala desa, rumah tangga, sumbangan tahunan, nafkah rakyat yang tinggal di

Kawasan Gabangh, Cawassin, Soukapoera, Bandongh, Paskamountsiang, Sammadangh dan Indramayou, seperti yang dicermati oleh wakil mualim Claes Hendriksz. dan Sersan Jan Carstenz untuk  Tuan-tuan Yang Mulia dan disampaikan sebagai masukan informasi untuk para tuan terhormat.

fields.long_title_en: List of Cacah-somah (rural households) in Priangan, West-Java, 1686
fields.short_title_id: Daftar Penduduk dan Rumah di Priangan 1686
fields.translation_en:
Roll which will presently reveal the names of the heads of the villages, families, annual contribution [and] means of subsistence of the people in the districts of Gabangh, Cawassin, Soukapoera, Bandongh, Parkamountsiang, Sammadangh and Indramayou, the result of the investigations of Second Mate Claes Hendriksz and Sergeant Jan Carstensz, compiled for the contemplation of the Most Honourable Sirs.
